column4: hey, any body in here know what could have caused this to happen during an update "http://img23.imageshack.us/img23/2061/screenshot3k.png"?
a bad download of the .deb file, or a poorly packaged .deb could maybe cause that sort of error.
You can try downloading the .deb package direct from packages.ubuntu.com and installing it by clicking on it.
i downloaded it multiple times and it isnt just that package that was messed up, and i tried a .deb i already had and knew was good
